answers.answer: I'm assuming you mean S-adenosyl-L-methionine, which is marketed as an over the counter antidepressant.  Anytime you consume something that is not FDA approved, you run the risk of getting unlabeled/unstudied side effects not only from the drug itself, but from the additives that may be part of the overall compound.  This particular antidepressant has been shown to interact with other medications and can cause mood disorders in some patients.  The side effect profile otherwise is ok with some patients reporting GI upset.  I did not find anything regarding nerve pain and discomfort, but if you're feeling better without it, just stop it altogether.  Good luck.

question: I posted earlier, with the previous two small strokes from hypertension and diabetes.  I have been taking the over the counter supplement SAM-E for depression for several months.Two days ago I ran out and stopped taking it.  Since then there has been much less nerve pain and discomfort in my face and arms.  This could just be a coincidence.I am curious if you are aware of any adverse reactions that could be caused by suplementation of the SAM-E molocule?
title: SAM-E supplement? Can it effect nervous system adversly?
